metadata.case_name: Dealer in Textiles v. State of Mysore

facts.text: Appellant was a dealer in textiles with head office at Mercara and branch at Bangalore.
Appellant assessed to sales tax on April 29, 1965 under Mysore General Sales Tax Act, 1957 for period October 1, 1957 to March 31, 1958.
Dispute over turnover of Rs. 3,87,200 estimated as value of stock of mill cloth held by appellant on December 14, 1957, whether exigible to tax.
Appellant's contention before assessing authority: turnover related to mill cloth on which additional excise duty was not payable and not paid, hence exempt from sales tax.
Assessing authority rejected appellant's contention.
Appeal to Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes dismissed.
Further appeal to Sales Tax Appellate Tribunal dismissed.
Appellant filed revision (T.R.P. No. 52 of 1965) and writ petition (No. 2349 of 1965) in Mysore High Court.
In writ petition, appellant contended sub-section 5A introduced in section 5 by Act No. 9 of 1964 ultra vires Mysore Legislature.
Mysore High Court Division Bench dismissed both petitions by common judgment dated November 16, 1966.
Mysore Sales Tax Act, 1957 came into force on October 1, 1957. Section 5 is principal charging section.
Under original Act, cloth in items 1-7 Second Schedule subjected to single point levy under section 5(5).
Parliament passed Additional Duties of Excise (Goods of Special Importance) Act, 1957 (58 of 1957) effective December 24, 1957.
Mysore Sales Tax Amendment Ordinance 1957 (9 of 1957) came into force December 14, 1957; replaced by Mysore Sales Tax Amendment Act 1958 (9 of 1958) retrospective from December 14, 1957.
Sub-section 5A inserted in section 5 by Amending Act 9/1958 for sales/purchases of specified goods on which excise/additional excise duty not paid.
Section 8(2) added by Act 9/1958 exempting sales/purchases of specified goods acquired on/after Dec 14, 1957 on which excise duty not payable.
Entry 8A in Fifth Schedule by Act 9/1958 effective April 1, 1958 exempting textiles.
In Writ Petition No. 368 of 1961, Mysore High Court held s.5(5A)(a) inapplicable if excise duty not leviable/paid; Entry 8A exempted stock.
Mysore Sales Tax Amendment Act 1964 (9 of 1964) substituted new s.5(5A) deemed always to have been there, taxing stock held on Dec 14, 1957 except for manufacturers proving excise paid.
Appellant sought to raise additional ground via C.M.P. 4827/70: post textiles declared goods (Feb 27, 1964?), legislature lost power for retrospective tax >2%.
Supreme Court permitted additional ground as pure question of law.

legal_issues.text: Whether turnover of Rs. 3,87,200 from stock of mill cloth held on December 14, 1957 was exigible to tax under s.5(5A) as amended.
Whether s.5(5A) introduced by Act 9/1964 levies tax on fictitious/deemed sales, beyond state power under Entry 54 List II.
Whether Mysore Legislature competent in 1964 to retrospectively levy sales tax on textiles sales (1957-58) at rates >2% after textiles became declared goods, given s.15 Central Sales Tax Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Turnover related to mill cloth on which additional excise duty not payable/not paid, hence exempt.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Mysore Sales Tax Act s.5(5A) as originally inserted; s.8(1) exemptions

petitioner_arguments.text: s.5(5A) by Act 9/1964 levies tax not on actual sales but on fictitious/deemed sales of stock, beyond Entry 54 State List power.
Act 9/1964 retrospective; legislature lacked power on enactment date (1964) to tax declared goods >2%; prior power immaterial.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.15 Central Sales Tax Act 1956; A Hajee Abdul Shakoor case

respondent_arguments.text: Tax imposed on actual sales, not deemed/fictitious; s.5(5A) valid.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Mysore Sales Tax Act s.5(5A) as amended

respondent_arguments.text: Amendments clarified levy on stock sales post-1957 amendments; deleted references to excise payment and s.8(1).

court_reasoning.text: High Court correctly held tax on actual sales of stock, not fictitious; amendments simplified levy on Dec 14, 1957 stock without excise condition except for manufacturers.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Appellant did not attack High Court reasoning on this.

court_reasoning.text: Legislature competent in 1964 to retrospectively tax 1957-58 sales of textiles (not then declared goods) at higher rates; power depends on enactment date for past periods, no fetter on retrospective levy for undeclared goods.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Textiles not declared goods till April 1, 1958; s.5(5A) deemed always there, fiction within power.

court_reasoning.text: Distinguished A Hajee Abdul Shakoor: there involved post-repeal competency for past essential goods; here, no such inhibition for pre-declared period.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Legal quality of goods changed post-April 1958.

holdings.text: Mysore Legislature competent to enact retrospective s.5(5A) taxing 1957-58 textiles sales at Second Schedule rates despite later declared goods status.
s.5(5A) levies tax on actual sales of stock held Dec 14, 1957.

precedents_cited.case_name: Innamuri Gopalan v. State of Andhra Pradesh
precedents_cited.relevance: Principle that s.5(5A)(a) requires excise duty levied and paid; applied in Mysore HC Writ 368/1961

precedents_cited.case_name: A Hajee Abdul Shakoor and Company v. State of Madras
precedents_cited.relevance: Legislative competency for retrospective laws depends on power at enactment, not past; distinguished as inapplicable here

statutes_cited.name: Mysore General Sales Tax Act, 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Principal charging section; sub-s.5A taxes sales/purchases of specified goods/stock on Dec 14, 1957; exemptions

statutes_cited.name: Additional Duties of Excise (Goods of Special Importance) Act, 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Imposed additional excise on cloth etc. from Dec 24, 1957; state amendments in lieu

statutes_cited.name: Mysore Sales Tax Amendment Act, 1958 (Act 9/1958)
statutes_cited.relevance: Inserted original s.5(5A) and s.8(2); retrospective from Dec 14, 1957; Entry 8A Fifth Schedule

statutes_cited.name: Mysore Sales Tax Amendment Act, 1964 (Act 9/1964)
statutes_cited.relevance: Substituted new s.5(5A) deemed always operative; taxed stock held Dec 14, 1957

statutes_cited.name: Central Sales Tax Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Restrictions on state tax on declared goods: max 2%, single stage; textiles declared post assessment period

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: State power to tax sales; argued limit to actual sales

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeals by special leave against Mysore High Court judgment upholding sales tax levy on appellant's 1957-58 stock turnover under s.5(5A) as amended retrospectively.
outcome.costs: Dismissed with costs. Only one hearing fee.

key_quotes.text: the power of the Legislature to retrospectively levy tax has not been controverted. There was no fetter on the power of the Legislature of Mysore on February 27, 1964 in enacting a measure imposing sales tax on the turnover of undeclared goods during the assessment period
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on retrospective legislative competence

key_quotes.text: The only limit on the power of a legislature to create a fiction is that it should not transcend its power by its creation.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Limits on legislative fictions in s.5(5A)
